title: Early adopter: push notification discovery
copy: This app doesn't really push new releases, so if you're seeing this, you're basically early. If this hits, tell me what you felt in the comments.
copy_template: This app doesn't really push new releases, so if you're seeing this, you're basically early. If {song_name} hits, tell me what you felt in the comments.
how_to_use: Use a simple selfie video or minimal studio clip. Keep it calm, direct-to-camera, 8–15s. Add the track as the audio and keep on-screen text identical to the caption.
why_it_works: Early-access framing makes viewers feel chosen and increases comments because you ask for a feeling rather than a rating.

title: Viral hook: 'Let me know if this finds you'
copy: Let me know if this finds you. If you're into melodic techno / progressive house, this is your kind of drop.
copy_template: Let me know if this finds you. If you're into {genre}, this is your kind of drop.
how_to_use: Overlay caption on any footage: studio, travel, night drive, crowd clip. Keep the first line on screen within the first second.
why_it_works: Simple, low-friction prompt. People who match the niche self-identify and comment, which drives distribution.

title: Behind the scenes: quiet flex (shh)
copy: Shhh. This is the bit I've been obsessing over.
copy_template: Shhh. This is the bit I've been obsessing over in {song_name}.
how_to_use: Film your screen/gear for 2–3 seconds, then cut to you reacting. Keep it understated.
why_it_works: Feels intimate and invites curiosity. Viewers lean in and replay to catch what you mean.

title: Performance clip: 'we just dropped the hardest…'
copy: POV: we just dropped the hardest part of the set and the room went quiet for a second.
copy_template: POV: we just dropped {song_name} and the room went quiet for a second.
how_to_use: Use a live moment with a visible crowd reaction (or your own reaction if no crowd). Keep it punchy: 6–12s.
why_it_works: Creates a social proof moment and a micro-story. Viewers watch for the 'quiet second' payoff.

title: Authenticity: 'I wrote this in a low moment'
copy: I wrote this when things were heavy. If it finds the right person, that's enough.
copy_template: I wrote {song_name} when things were heavy. If it finds the right person, that's enough.
how_to_use: Quiet selfie video. Keep eye contact. Let the emotional section play (breakdown or hook).
why_it_works: Emotional honesty increases saves and comments because people respond with their own experiences.

title: Comment bait: 'rate the drop'
copy: Be honest: is this drop a KEEP or a SKIP?
copy_template: Be honest: is {song_name} a KEEP or a SKIP?
how_to_use: Play the drop immediately. Add big on-screen buttons KEEP / SKIP. Keep total length under 10s.
why_it_works: Low-effort interaction. People love picking a side, which boosts comment velocity.

title: Studio BTS: 'made this instead of scrolling'
copy: I was about to doomscroll… then I made this instead. Worth it?
copy_template: I was about to doomscroll… then I made {song_name} instead. Worth it?
how_to_use: Start with you holding your phone, then cut to DAW clip with the hook/drop. Keep it snappy.
why_it_works: Relatable premise + quick payoff. Encourages 'worth it' comments and shares to friends.

title: New single promo: 'I need to release this ASAP'
copy: I need to release this ASAP. Should I stop tweaking and drop it?
copy_template: I need to release {song_name} ASAP. Should I stop tweaking and drop it?
how_to_use: Open on text-only for 1s, then cut straight to the most euphoric 6–10s.
why_it_works: Pulls viewers into the decision. They comment advice, which increases reach.

title: Numbers proof: 'thanks for the streams'
copy: This is wild. Thank you for the streams. I'm still processing it.
copy_template: This is wild. Thank you for the streams on {song_name}. I'm still processing it.
how_to_use: Slide 1: selfie. Slide 2: Spotify/SC stats screenshot. Keep copy short and genuine.
why_it_works: Gratitude posts perform because fans feel included in the momentum and are more likely to share.

title: Night drive: 'feels good today'
copy: Next time you're driving at night, play this loud. It hits different.
copy_template: Next time you're driving at night, play {song_name} loud. It hits different.
how_to_use: Use night driving footage or moody street shots. Put the hook section underneath.
why_it_works: Gives the viewer a use-case and a feeling to chase, increasing saves for later listening.

title: Rehearsal / practice: passive watch
copy: Another day, another session. This is the bit that finally clicked.
copy_template: Another day, another session. This is the bit in {song_name} that finally clicked.
how_to_use: Show a loop in the DAW, synth jam, or controller performance. Keep camera angle fixed.
why_it_works: Feels private and unpolished, which builds trust and watch time.

title: Micro-story: 'I wrote this after…'
copy: I wrote this after a rough week and didn't expect anyone to connect with it. If you do, tell me where you're listening from.
copy_template: I wrote {song_name} after a rough week and didn't expect anyone to connect with it. If you do, tell me where you're listening from.
how_to_use: Slide 1: selfie. Slide 2: a moody studio photo or artwork. Keep text readable and short.
why_it_works: Invites empathy + a simple comment prompt (location), boosting interaction.

title: Genre gate: 'if you like X, you'll like this'
copy: If you like Anyma / Tale Of Us / ARTBAT-style melodies, you'll probably like this.
copy_template: If you like {ref_artist_1} / {ref_artist_2} / {ref_artist_3}-style melodies, you'll probably like {song_name}.
how_to_use: Put the text on screen in the first 0.5s. Use the most recognisable melodic hook.
why_it_works: Instant audience self-selection. People who like the references stop and listen longer.

title: Soft challenge: 3-second test
copy: Give me 3 seconds. If you don't feel something by then, scroll.
copy_template: Give me 3 seconds. If you don't feel something by then, scroll. ({song_name})
how_to_use: Add a 3-second countdown overlay. Start at the hook, not the intro.
why_it_works: Creates a mini-commitment and keeps retention through the countdown payoff.

title: Gig promo: 'tour poster' style
copy: If you're near {city}, come say hi. I'll play this one loud.
copy_template: If you're near {city}, come say hi. I'll play {song_name} loud. {date_range}
how_to_use: Slide 1: selfie or venue pic. Slide 2: clean tour poster/lineup graphic. Keep the CTA minimal.
why_it_works: Feels personal and direct, increases shares to local friends.

title: Sound design flex: 'this synth took ages'
copy: This sound took way longer than it should have. Worth it though.
copy_template: This sound in {song_name} took way longer than it should have. Worth it though.
how_to_use: Show the synth/plugin chain for 1–2s, then play the musical context immediately after.
why_it_works: Producers pause/replay to analyse, boosting watch time and saves.

title: Reply to comment: 'prove it'
copy: Someone said this wouldn't work in a club… so I'm testing it this weekend.
copy_template: Someone said {song_name} wouldn't work in a club… so I'm testing it this weekend.
how_to_use: Use TikTok reply-to-comment format. Put the comment on screen and cut straight to the drop.
why_it_works: Turns scepticism into a narrative. Viewers comment to take sides and follow the outcome.

title: Low effort: 'no caption'
copy: No caption. Just listen.
copy_template: No caption. Just listen. ({song_name})
how_to_use: Use a strong visual loop (sunset, city lights, studio slow-pan). Let the hook do the work.
why_it_works: Feels confident and non-salesy. Works best when the music is instantly emotive.

title: Audience finder: 'what sub-genre is this?'
copy: What sub-genre would you call this? I'm trying to find my people.
copy_template: What sub-genre would you call {song_name}? I'm trying to find my people.
how_to_use: Play the most genre-defining 8 seconds. Keep the question on-screen the whole time.
why_it_works: People love categorising music. Comments become a genre debate, driving distribution.

title: Hook: 'if you're early, you're my favourite'
copy: If you're early to this, you're genuinely my favourite kind of listener.
copy_template: If you're early to {song_name}, you're genuinely my favourite kind of listener.
how_to_use: Start with you speaking/lip-syncing the line, then cut to hook.
why_it_works: Compliments increase engagement and shares; early adopters feel recognised.

title: Early adopter: 'you're here before the algorithm'
copy: If you're hearing this before the algorithm catches it, you're exactly who I made it for.
copy_template: If you're hearing {song_name} before the algorithm catches it, you're exactly who I made it for.
how_to_use: Open with the line as on-screen text, then immediately play the most euphoric 6–10 seconds (breakdown-to-drop works best).
why_it_works: Signals exclusivity and invites listeners to feel like tastemakers, increasing comments and saves.

title: Relatable: 'I can't stop replaying this 8 seconds'
copy: I can't stop replaying this 8 seconds. If you get it, you get it.
copy_template: I can't stop replaying this 8 seconds in {song_name}. If you get it, you get it.
how_to_use: Loop the exact 8 seconds twice. Put 'replaying this 8 seconds' as a big caption. Keep video 12-16s.
why_it_works: You're literally designing rewatch behaviour into the post, which boosts retention signals.

title: Direct ask: 'tell me the timestamp'
copy: What's your timestamp? The exact second it hits for you.
copy_template: What's your timestamp in {song_name}? The exact second it hits for you.
description: Comment prompt that also drives full listens.
how_to_use: Use a longer 20–30s clip that includes build and payoff. Pin the best timestamp comments.
why_it_works: People scan to find 'their moment', increasing watch time and replays. Comments are specific and plentiful.

title: Soft flex: 'made this with no budget'
copy: No budget. No team. Just a laptop and stubbornness. If it moves you, that's the win.
copy_template: No budget. No team. Just a laptop and stubbornness. If {song_name} moves you, that's the win.
how_to_use: Selfie video in a normal setting. Cut to the hook for 6–10 seconds. Keep it sincere and calm.
why_it_works: Underdog stories invite support without feeling like an ad, increasing shares and saves.

title: A/B test: 'which drop is better?'
copy: Quick vote: Drop A or Drop B?
copy_template: Quick vote for {song_name}: Drop A or Drop B?
description: Split test to drive engagement and feedback.
how_to_use: Play Drop A (5–6s), hard cut, then Drop B (5–6s). Put big A/B labels on-screen.
why_it_works: People love voting, and you get useful product feedback while boosting comments.

title: POV: 'you just found your new late-night track'
copy: POV: you just found your new late-night track.
copy_template: POV: you just found your new late-night track. ({song_name})
description: Simple POV hook suited to melodic genres.
how_to_use: Use moody visuals: city lights, rain, studio b-roll, driving. Keep clip 8–12s and start at the hook.
why_it_works: Instantly tells viewers what emotion/context to expect, increasing saves for later listening.

title: Producer angle: 'guess the plugin'
copy: Producer challenge: guess the plugin that made this lead.
copy_template: Producer challenge: guess the plugin that made the lead in {song_name}.
how_to_use: Show 2 seconds of the sound, then 1 second of the project, then back to the sound in context.
why_it_works: Comments become guesses, and replays increase as people listen for clues.

title: Hook: 'if this finds the right person'
copy: I don't need everyone to like this. I just need it to find the right person.
copy_template: I don't need everyone to like {song_name}. I just need it to find the right person.
how_to_use: Quiet selfie, neutral background. Let the emotional peak play underneath. Keep it under 15s.
why_it_works: It disarms the viewer and lowers the 'ad' feeling, increasing watch-through and saves.

title: Storytelling: 'the first time I heard this I…'
copy: The first time I heard this idea back, I just stared at the screen. That's how I knew it was the one.
copy_template: The first time I heard {song_name} back, I just stared at the screen. That's how I knew it was the one.
how_to_use: Start with a 1–2s shot of the project file, then cut to the section that caused the reaction.
why_it_works: Creates anticipation and makes viewers listen for 'the one' moment, boosting retention.

title: Community: 'where are you listening from?'
copy: If this is your vibe, where are you listening from?
copy_template: If {song_name} is your vibe, where are you listening from?
how_to_use: Put the question on-screen. Use a hook section with clear emotion. Reply to comments with city shoutouts.
why_it_works: People love being seen, and location comments stack quickly and push reach.

title: Minimal ad: 'put your phone down and listen'
copy: Put your phone down for 10 seconds. Just listen.
copy_template: Put your phone down for 10 seconds. Just listen to {song_name}.
description: Bold instruction that suits emotive drops.
how_to_use: Use calming visuals (sunset, ocean, city timelapse). Use the most 'transporting' 10 seconds.
why_it_works: Direct instruction can snap people out of scrolling and increases completion rate.

title: Behind-the-scenes: 'this is why the breakdown works'
copy: Tiny detail, big difference. This is why the breakdown works.
copy_template: Tiny detail, big difference. This is why the breakdown in {song_name} works.
how_to_use: Show one automation lane or one layer mute/unmute. Then play the section with/without for 2 seconds each.
why_it_works: Satisfying 'aha' moment keeps viewers watching and encourages producer comments.

title: Early adopter: 'save this for later'
copy: Don't scroll past this. Save it and come back when you've got headphones.
copy_template: Don't scroll past {song_name}. Save it and come back when you've got headphones.
description: Save-driven CTA that fits melodic music.
how_to_use: Use a hook with lots of stereo width and atmosphere. Keep it 8–12s.
why_it_works: Headphone framing drives saves, which is a strong signal for distribution.

title: Confidence hook: 'I'm not changing this drop'
copy: I'm not changing this drop. If you hate it, fair. If you love it, you're my people.
copy_template: I'm not changing the drop in {song_name}. If you hate it, fair. If you love it, you're my people.
how_to_use: Start with the statement, then smash into the drop. Keep the drop section loud and obvious.
why_it_works: Creates a 'pick a side' dynamic without negativity, boosting comments and watch-through.

title: Narrative: 'I nearly deleted this project'
copy: I nearly deleted this project last week. Glad I didn't.
copy_template: I nearly deleted {song_name} last week. Glad I didn't.
how_to_use: Show the project file name for 1 second, then play the hook. Keep it concise and confident.
why_it_works: Creates a before/after emotional arc, which boosts curiosity and engagement.

title: Fan-building: 'you're early, I'll remember'
copy: If you're here early, I'll remember you when this grows. Appreciate you.
copy_template: If you're here early for {song_name}, I'll remember you when this grows. Appreciate you.
how_to_use: Selfie + hook section. Reply to early comments with actual appreciation (names/handles if platform allows).
why_it_works: Signals community and loyalty, encouraging repeat engagement from the same viewers.

title: Hook: 'this belongs on a sunrise set'
copy: This belongs in a sunrise set.
copy_template: {song_name} belongs in a sunrise set.
how_to_use: Use sunrise footage or warm golden visuals. Start at the most uplifting melodic moment.
why_it_works: Gives the music a place in the viewer's imagination, increasing saves and shares.

title: Direct engagement: 'should I release this or keep it unreleased?'
copy: Should I release this or keep it as an unreleased weapon?
copy_template: Should I release {song_name} or keep it as an unreleased weapon?
description: DJ culture framing that fits melodic techno/trance.
how_to_use: Use a clubby peak moment. Put the question on-screen. Encourage comments: 'release' or 'keep unreleased'.
why_it_works: Viewers feel involved in the decision; binary comments stack fast and boost reach.

title: Emotional: 'if you've ever needed a reset'
copy: If you've ever needed a reset, this one's for you.
copy_template: If you've ever needed a reset, {song_name} is for you.
how_to_use: Use the most 'relief' section (usually breakdown or melodic hook). Keep face-to-camera calm and genuine.
why_it_works: Broad emotional resonance increases saves and shares, especially for melodic/progressive audiences.

title: BTS: 'I fixed one thing and the whole track opened up'
copy: I changed one tiny thing and the whole track opened up.
copy_template: I changed one tiny thing in {song_name} and the whole track opened up.
how_to_use: Before/after: play 2 seconds before, then 2 seconds after. Show the single change (automation, layer, EQ).
why_it_works: Transformation content triggers replays and comments from producers and fans alike.
